summary: Fab represents digital fabrication and maker culture. It embodies the spirit of DIY, creativity, and innovation in the digital realm. This concept is closely tied to keeping the web weird, open-source principles, and guerrilla-style creativity. It encourages unconventional thinking, hands-on creation, and the preservation of a diverse, user-driven internet ecosystem. Fab culture resists uniformity and corporate control, championing digital ownership and the freedom to explore and innovate in the online space.
excerpt: To Keep The Web Weird, engage with ISOC for internet advocacy, embrace open-source principles, explore digital fabrication, adopt guerrilla-style creativity, and champion digital ownership. These steps foster innovation, preserve internet freedom, and encourage unconventional thinking.
